author: ryanleeschneider
content: Can someone explain what the impact of the voting not reaching a majority is?  does that affect finalization?

author: stevencook
content: no new validators get added from the validated deposits on execution chain

author: ajsutton
content: Just means that new deposits aren't brought in so validators can't be added. Finalization continues as normal.  The voting in this case is about the eth1 data voting (ie for the current state of the eth1 chain), not the attestations which are voting on the current state of the beacon chain.

author: ryanleeschneider
content:
aside: do NOT include `engine` in `--http.api` or `--ws.api` that will expose the non-auth'd API to your network.  Likewise you probably don't want to bind `--authrpc.addr` to `0.0.0.0` unless your CL is on another machine.

FWIW I'm running w/

```
/usr/bin/geth --ropsten --syncmode full  --http --http.addr 0.0.0.0 --http.corsdomain * --http.port 8545 --http.api web3,net,eth --http.vhosts * --http.rpcprefix / --port 30303 --datadir /mnt/local/ethereum --ws --ws.addr 0.0.0.0 --ws.port 8546 --ws.origins=* --ws.api web3,net,eth --ws.rpcprefix / --authrpc.jwtsecret /mnt/local/ethereum/engine-jwt.key --override.terminaltotaldifficulty=${TTD_OVERRIDE}
```

Plus some other unrelated settings.

CRIT Could not connect to a suitable eth1 node. author: stevencook
content:
for lighthouse beacon node i am using:
```
lighthouse --network ropsten --datadir=/opt/eth/ropsten/lighthouse bn --eth1 --eth1-endpoints=http://localhost:8545 --http --metrics --disable-upnp --subscribe-all-subnets --staking --http-address 127.0.0.1 --import-all-attestations --port 9001 --merge --jwt-secrets /opt/eth/ropsten/geth/geth/jwtsecret --execution-endpoints http://localhost:8551 --suggested-fee-recipient <0xETH_ADRESS>
```
i also built based on this PR though: https://github.com/sigp/lighthouse/pull/3234
